conclusion: Determine the change in magnetic flux as the coil rotates 60° downward around the z-axis.
Initial position of the coil has magnetic field B along the positive x-axis and area A is 0.4 m².
Magnetic flux Φ is given by Φ = B · A · cos(θ), where θ is the angle between the magnetic field and the normal to the coil.
Initially, the coil is perpendicular to the x-axis, so θ = 0°.
Initial magnetic flux Φ_i is 0.04 Wb.
After rotating 60° downward, the angle θ becomes 60°.
Final magnetic flux Φ_f is 0.02 Wb.
Change in magnetic flux ΔΦ is -0.02 Wb.
The change in the magnetic flux passing through the coil is 0.02 Wb.
